other_tests.findings: Heterozygous mutation in exon 3 of the FGF23 gene (c.536G /H11022A, p.Arg179Gln) confirming ADHR.
FGF23 values nearly doubled within a week after withdrawal, with declining serum phosphate levels.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Phosphate loss remained evident after 4 weeks with TRP values similar to those before withdrawal.

other_tests.date: Beginning at age 5.6 years when medication was withdrawn
other_tests.findings: FGF23 remained within reference range but elevated for the level of hypophosphatemia.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After medication withdrawal, serum phosphate levels continued to decline and were not normalized until iron supplementation began.

other_tests.findings: Serum iron and ferritin levels improved, TRP and TmP/GFR eventually normalized.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Rickets medication could be halved twice and fully withdrawn by age 9.3 years; phosphate and iron metabolism remained normal following withdrawal.
